entries.meaning: The course (sequence of events or actions) that follows something; subsequent course.
examples: And if she should, which Heaven forbid,
O’rethrow me, as the Fidler did,
What after-course have I to take,
’Gainst losing all I have at Stake?

entries.meaning: (archaic, regional) The final course of a meal.

examples: […]  although her education had only the finish of the common schools, yet she had superior teachers, who directed her in an after-course of reading and study, which took her far beyond the ordinary school course.
